PAGE.TITLE: XFS corrupter
PAGE.CONTENT:
This script is the result of an analysis of 8 weeks! We had some corrupted files using XFS, but we fumbled during a long time to been able to get a reproducible scenario: this script.
But the main issue was a turf war inside GE during the first quarter of 2005. The story is now finished, Jim and Rich received recognitionhttp://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=linux-xfs&m=111475870622632
enHTML (Mhttp://oss.sgi.com/archives/xfs/2005-04/msg00379.html
enHTML, Mhttp://archives.free.net.ph/message/20050429.070506.22ac6c73.en.html
enHTML) for this (and, despite the fight, I must tell they also worked a lot on this). Emmanuel and myself, we don't really care about this posterity, we just want a working OS. Nevertheless, it must be known that Emmanuel found the trigger (unmouting the partition) and I built the reproducible scenario.
#!/bin/ksh -x
numberOfSmallFiles=1000000
directory=/export/home1/sdc_image_pool/new
device=`df -k $directory | tail -1 | awk '{ print $1}'`
find $directory -type f -exec rm {} \;
# --- fragment the disk ---
i=0
while [[ i -lt $numberOfSmallFiles ]]
do
echo "*" > $directory/small_$i
i=$(($i+1))
done
i=0
while ( dd if=/dev/zero of=$directory/orimularge_$i bs=1M count=256 )
do
i=$(($i+1))
done
i=0
while [[ i -lt $numberOfSmallFiles ]]
do
rm $directory/small_$i
i=$(($i+2))
done
# --- create several copies of the same file ---
dd if=/dev/urandom of=$directory/data_reference bs=1K count=512
i=0
while ( cp $directory/data_reference $directory/data_$i )
do
i=$(($i+1))
done
# --- mount/umount ---
umount $device
mount $device
# --- check that the copies are equal ---
find $directory -name "data_*[0-9]" -exec cmp $directory/data_reference {} \;
